page.title: 06Religion in Flint
page.content: The Parish was built in{1848,}5 chapels have closed but 9 have survived. The{Catholic}church thrives with 700 people taking communion. About 150 take communion in the parish church. On Sunday 80-100 in{St. John's {church}and 30-40 in{Caersalem Welsh {chapel.}Every chapel has a Sunday school in the morning and the Catholics have two schools- St. Mary's Primary school, and the Blessed Richard Gwyn. The{English}chapels are holding their own, but{Welsh}chapels decline. Services are held on Sunday morning and evening and every day in the Catholic church. One Minister said there was a decline in morals and behaviour and people use chapel for christening, weddings and funerals.
